name: Mini Corn Dogs
description: In the spirit of summer fairs all over the country, I made a lightly sweetened cornmeal batter, then dunked hot dog chunks into it and deep-fried them into bronzed nuggets — in other words, bite-size corn dogs. (Feel free to fry whole hot dogs on sticks if you’re going for authenticity.)
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon kosher salt, more for seasoning

recipeInstructions.text: In a deep fryer or saucepan, heat 4 inches of oil to 375 degrees.

In a large bowl, whisk together cornmeal, flour, sugar, 1 teaspoon salt and the baking powder. In a separate bowl, whisk together the milk and egg. Stir the wet ingredients into the dry until just combined.
Coat hot dogs evenly in the batter. Working in batches, fry until golden brown all over, turning if needed, about 2 minutes. Drain on paper towels. While warm, season with kosher salt.
